boardgame.name: Channeling
boardgame.description:
Channeling is a game of tactical spellcasting. Each match represents a battle between channeling wizards - be it a schoolyard quarrel at the academy, the real stakes struggle of a magical war or a grand clash on the very edges of reality.

The players draw cards from a standard decks full of basic spells, but each sorcery cast and summoned magical entity becomes unique combination between its original form and the channeling abilities of the caster.

There are different modes of play - in the most basic one that's recommended for learning, each player may cast trough the four basic elemental channels (Flame, Rock, Frost and Lightning) before dabbling in asymmetrical duels where the same elements are randomly drawn and duels utilizing advanced channels and player powers.

boardgame.name: Vowel Bingo
boardgame.description:
From the instructions:
"Vowel Bingo is a fun-filled way to strengthen and reinforce vowel skills. Each playing card contains eight labeled illustrations of objects having long or short vowel sounds in their names. The purpose of game play is to match each object's game with its correct vowel."

Vowel Bingo is similar to standard bingo, but in order to place their markers, players must know and match short and long vowel sounds. Each player has a card with as series of pictures labeled with the corresponding words. The caller calls out a vowel sound--long a, for example--and players must search their card for a word/picture with a long a in the word. When a player has a complete row, their card is checked by the caller to make sure the vowels are identified correctly. If so, the player wins. If not, play continues until someone has a correct row.

boardgame.name: Forge of the Giant God
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

"In search of powerful weapons to wield against the Storm Tyrant, the adventurers follow a map found in the lair of the hill giant Grenseldek, which leads them to the tomb of legendary giantslayer Nargrym Steelhand. Armed with these weapons of legend, the adventurers then head into the treacherous Mindspin Mountains in search of the valley where the Storm Tyrant is recruiting giants for his army. The heroes must sneak past the legions of giants inhabiting the winding valley before making their way to the horde’s headquarters—an ancient temple dedicated to the giant god Minderhal. Once there, they must awaken a mighty artifact and disband the mustering army before the giants can be unleashed on the world!

This volume of Pathfinder Adventure Path continues the Giantslayer Adventure Path and includes:

“Forge of the Giant God,” a Pathfinder adventure for 7th-level characters, by Tim Hitchcock.
A gazetteer of the Mindspin Mountains, one of Avistan’s largest mountain ranges, by Mark Moreland.
A close look at the faith of the giant god Minderhal, by Sean K Reynolds.
A tale of escape and trickery in the Pathfinder's Journal, by Greg A. Vaughan.
Four new monsters, by Benjamin Bruck, Tim Hitchcock, and Sean K Reynolds."

boardgame.name: If Wishes Were Fishes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Back in the mystical land of Tengoku, the party finds themselves called on a quest by a not so coy Koi named Coy. With the island in danger, a walking and talking fish running the risk of gill cancer thanks to his new cigar habit, and a missing enchanted gem, the land Far East of Brattleburg may soon find itself going south! Can the heroes restore the balance, solve the mystery of the world fish, and eat their takeout noodles before they go cold? Find the answer in "If Wishes were Fishes!"

From Episode 31 - If Wishes were Fishes

With a new year comes new GagMen and we start off this year with a big fish story. Taking it back to our Asian story “The Tao of Ato”, we journey back to the mystical island of Tengoku to chase down a magical gem and fight the worlds biggest goldfish. With nothing more than an incoherent plot and a bottle full of Mountain Dew the GagMen will take on this deadly fish and this time they aren’t going to be floundering around. Though we have a few laughs for the halibut.

boardgame.name: 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Library
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to 100 Oddities for a Wizard's Library, third entry in Skirmisher Publishing's ever-expanding series of curiosities designed to fill the empty corners of your campaign worlds!

Oddities may clutter a shelf or lie forgotten in a corner but are not defined by where they are so much as what they are and are unusual by their very nature. A dead rat in the basement of an abandoned building is not an oddity, but the same dead rat with its eyes sewn shut is. Oddities make you think about why they exist, how they ended up there, even what the hell they are, questions that are key to an engaging and invigorating roleplaying experience.

Oddities are intended to aid GM creativity and turn possibly bland areas or gaming episodes into something more. The goal of this publication and the others in this series is to make things more fun and to take your imagination in directions it might not otherwise have gone.

boardgame.name: Shadows in Focus: City by Shadow - Cheyenne
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Minefield of Opportunity

The number of ways you can step wrong in Cheyenne are higher than a lot of shadowrunners can count. There are political, ethnic, tribal, and racial divides, and stepping on the wrong side of them can not only end your job prospects, but it can put you in a hastily dug hole in the ground. Move quickly and be agile, though, and you can slip through the snares that trip up lesser runners, accumulating the street rep and nuyen that will put you at the top of the runner heap.

Cheyenne is the second book in the Shadows in Focus: Sioux Nation series, providing details about a Sixth World location steeped in tradition, conflict, and both technological and Awakened dangers. With location details, information on power players, and more, Cheyenne will help flesh out the Shadowrun setting for players and build adventures and campaigns for gamemasters.

boardgame.name: Track Pack 1
boardgame.description:
From the Instructions:

To use a Track Pack, discard the Jacks and Kings from your deck (trust us, you can have plenty of fun without them!), leaving the numbered cards, aces, queens, and jokers. The numbered cards are used for Random Events - you can keep that pile separate.

The ten remaining cards are used for the Track Pack, and are easy or beneficial (Queens), challenging (Aces) or murderous (Jokers). Each time a card is drawn it is discarded; the same leg never appears twice!

Alternatively, you can roll a ten-sided die; however, you may have to reroll duplicate results.

User Summary:

This Track Pack includes random track legs for the following six courses:

Les Angeles - Bright lights, fast cars, and hot girls, this is street racing at its finest!
Dry Heat - Keep your cool when things get hot, or you'll blow more than your radiator!
Palm Tree City - Welcome to Palm Tree City, where it's bikini season all year long!
Nature's Bounty - Take in the fresh air, pick up the farm girls, and get down and dirty on back roads!
Tropic Heat - Welcome to the jungle, baby!
Northern Exposure - Time to hit the slopes and find those ski bunnies!

boardgame.name: The Falklands Ablaze
boardgame.description:
BACKGROUND: The Falklands Ablaze is a solitaire semi-historical simulation of the Falklands War (May – June 1982). The Game begins shortly after the Argentinians capture the Port City of Stanley after a surprise attack. The British have mustered their Task Forces and have arrived just of the northern coast of the Falkland Islands. The British must now establish a Beach Head and advance their forces towards Port Stanley to defeat the Argentinian Forces and liberate the British Settlers.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the British Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your forces and naval squadrons to capture Port Stanley, Port Stanley Airfield and 10 other Argentine controlled Settlements before the Campaign Deck is depleted.

GAME FEATURES: The Falklands Ablaze contains many colorful counters including ground forces, ships and aircraft. The Game includes rules for Ground, Sea and Air Combat.

The Falklands Ablaze can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

boardgame.name: Wallachia 20
boardgame.description:
Wallachia 20 features two complete games covering a pair of important major battles fought during the Russo-Turkish War of 1806 – 1812 for control of the key Danube river port of Rousse in the province of Wallachia.

Rousse 20 simulates the earlier of these two engagements, fought on 22 June, 1811. In this battle Ottoman forces advanced northwards, towards the present day Bulgarian-Romanian frontier. Russian infantry and cannons were able to stall the polyglot Ottoman army, and although they managed to eke out a marginal victory their commander, General Kutuzov, chose to yield the key town of Rousse to the Ottomans, convincing them they had won a great victory. The Czar was not pleased.

Slobozia 20 focuses on the latter battle of 2 October 1811. In this engagement Kutuzov conducted a surprise march which cut off and surrounded the bulk of the Ottoman army, trapping it on the northern (Bulgarian) shore of the Danube. The result was a decisive Russian victory that permitted negotiations to end the war. This had the dual advantage of allowing Russia to transfer key reserves to oppose Napoleon’s invasion of Russia in 1812, and also prevented Austria from contributing more forces to support the French invasion.

boardgame.name: The Gallows
boardgame.description:
The Gallows are ready! Mages accused of wickedness are prepared to meet their end. It's high noon and yet the sky darkens as if it too knows what the future brings. Today, all of mages on the gallows will face their final fate. One by one the wicked will be executed until only one remains...

...and you want that one remaining to be your client. That's right you're a lawyer and the mage you are protecting is a secret. Your job is to protect your mage by making sure all the other mages on the gallows are executed first. Of course, the other lawyers are also secretly protecting one of the mages.

In The Gallows each player is secretly defending one of the characters in the center. On your turn you add one vote token to any character and then move one vote token from a character to a different character. Once a character has enough votes they are executed. Whoever had the most votes on a character when they are executed scores the conviction worth one point. When only one character remains in the middle, whoever was protecting them scores an acquittal worth lots of points.

Play consists of players trying to manipulate the votes so they score convictions and prevent their own defendant from getting convicted.

Jade is at the core of the Jadepunk setting. If you are a fan of Jadepunk, you are not going to want to miss the Jadetech series.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn 5
The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
boardgame.description:
The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a fast-paced, light-hearted card game for two or more players. You and your increasingly mighty party of adventuring companions have spent all day slogging through the dungeon, killing monsters and taking their stuff. Now you’re back in town, healed up, cleaned up, and ready to party at the Red Dragon Inn. Drink, gamble, and roughhouse with your friends. But don’t forget to keep an eye on your gold. If you run out, you’ll have to spend the night in the stables. Oh… and try not to get too beaten up or too drunk. If you black out, your friends will continue the party without you… after they loot your body for gold, of course! The last conscious adventurer with gold wins the game!

The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a standalone game for 2-4 players. It expands on "The Red Dragon Inn" family of box sets and single-character expansions called Allies. You can mix and match characters from any of these sets, letting you build the party composition of your choice! Each of the box sets includes four unique characters, a drink deck, gold pieces, and all the parts for 2-4 players to play right out of the box. Each of the Allies expansions includes a character deck as well as gold pieces and bits so you can add another character to a box set (thus making a 2-4 player collection playable by 2-5 players).

Sera the Fleetfooted: Sera is a stealthy rogue whose speed and agility allow her to take down roomfuls of bad guys before they even know what’s happening. The dungeon’s beefiest monsters are no match for her flying daggers! She didn’t get so skilled by slacking off, though. Even while she’s partying, she continues training to make sure she’s always at the top of her game.


The Good: She hones her skills by sparring with her friends.
The Bad: Sometimes she does this without warning them first…


Lizwick the Collector: Lizwick is a consummate problem solver with an unrivaled collection of gear. Her wondrous Bag of Holding contains rare and peculiar items of all descriptions. She is always on the lookout for the next amazing whatchamacallit to add to her collection. Lizwick has gotten The Party out of many a jam with the clever application of the wrong tool at the right time.


The Good: Lizwick’s collection is the envy of academies, guilds and hoarders alike!
The Bad: …and they’d like their stuff back.


Joran the Trickster: Joran’s penchant for pranks earned him a student “sabbatical” from the Mage’s Collegium. Fortunately, Zot saw some potential in the boy, and decided to take him adventuring for some valuable field experience. The young mage’s humor has proven to be mostly harmless to his new friends. He puts his clever brain to good use by pulling fast ones on the bad guys.


The Good: Joran’s talent for misdirection makes him the perfect weapon against enemy spell-casters.
The Bad: It also makes him the perfect weapon against his friends’ gold, their sobriety, their patience…


Zakhan the Drunken Master: Zakhan’s father is a solemn elven noble and a guru of meditative martial combat techniques. His mother was a rowdy barbarian warchief with a penchant for throwing wild parties. This unique heritage has allowed Zakhan to hone a seemingly reckless hybrid fighting style of his own. His opponents who underestimate his “drunken” martial arts do so at their own peril!


The Good: Zakhan’s drunken fighting techniques make him a formidable foe.
The Bad: Sometimes he’s actually just drunk.


But wait, there's more! The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is also a massive storage solution for all previous sets (with room for more). You get a massive storage box plus dividers, new play mats for all previously released characters, updated tokens and more! Check it out:


6 Unique Decks (4 40-card Character Decks, 1 18-card Item Deck, 1 30-card Drink Deck)
29 Character-specific Player Mats (with replacements for all previous sets!)
35 Cardboard Deck Dividers
1 Cardboard Chi Marker
4 Glass Fortitude Markers
4 Glass Alcohol Content Markers
9 Remastered Cardboard Fortitude Markers
9 Remastered Cardboard Alcohol Content Markers
55 Remastered Gold Coin Tokens
9 New Platinum Coin Tokens
10 Foam Spacer Blocks
2 Cloth Drawstring Bags
Ziptop Baggies
Rules for playing The Red Dragon Inn

boardgame.name: Arcology
boardgame.description:
The boardgames sets in the Small City trilogy and expands the concepts of the game in the future.

Arcology is a 3D city boardgame that adds the mechanisms of Small City to the game Town Center already released in 2012-2013-2014

The game is divided into 8 seasons where the players try to raise the highest city by minimizing the pollution generated by the factories. To the concept of adjacency already developed in Card City and Town Center, the players will use the Residential-Shops-Leisure cubes in order to host the most citizens as possible...

Players will also allocate a job to their citizens and will move them in the 3D structure...

boardgame.name: Star Wars Yatzy
boardgame.description:
As in Yatzee you throw five dice. You can throw each die 3 times and you score by getting certain combinations.

In Star Wars Yatzy you don´t have a fixed set of combinations, but instead you draw mission cards. Each player have two mission cards and they draw a new if they have less than 2 cards. you dicard a card if you finish a mission. If you don´t use all your throws you can add one mission card.

When one player have finished 8 missions the game ends and the player with most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Motebringer: An Edgewalker Archetype
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some edgewalkers reject the philosophy of balance espoused by the majority of their peers, electing instead to focus their attentions on the powers of light and radiance. For their part, the rest of the edgewalkers don't really seem to mind. After all, how can one toe the path between two extremes if those extremes didn't exist?

Like edgewalkers, motebringers understand that light and darkness are two sides of the same coin. Unlike edgewalkers, motebringers believe that one of these halves is inferior to the other. Totally locked out from selecting darkness-based waypoints, the motebringer specializes in light-based waypoints and the shaping of physical material from nothing more than a glimmer of radiance.

The motebringer's iconic ability is the creation of a radiant shawl, effectively a sheet of light worn in the shoulders slot. Each morning, the motebringer can customize his radiant shawl with a number of infusions, which grant offensive, defensive, and utility abilities to it. Effectively, the motebringer gives up access to half of the edgewalker's talents in exchange for a cape that can and will rival artifacts by the time 20th level rolls around.

Product Features

The Motebringer edgewalker archetype [Requires The Edgewalker: Wielder of Light and Darkness]
30 infusions for use with radiant shawls

boardgame.name: WyrmRider
boardgame.description:
WyrmRider is a 2 player microgame in the one page "postcard" style

Setup: One player places the 3 wyrms anywhere on the 6 spaces on their side of the board. The other player places the 4 riders anywhere on the six spaces on their side. Players may orient the counters in any direction.

Play: Beginning with the wyrm player, each player takes a turn by rotating, moving and combatting.

Rotating - A player may rotate their counter 60° clockwise or counterclockwise.

Moving - The player may then move any counter 1 hex in distance in any direction, maintaining the counter’s current orientation. If the player chose not to rotate a counter they may instead move a counter 2 hexes in distance.

Combatting - After rotating, and/or moving, a player may attack one adjacent piece of the opposing player with any of their counters. A player may only attack in the directions indicated by the red arrows (arrows must point perpendicular to an adjacent hex side). Players each roll one six-sided die, the attacking player gains a +1 to their roll.

If the attacker’s roll is greater than the defender, the defending piece is removed.

If the defender has more than one counter adjacent to the attacking counter and they have lost combat, they may immediately combat once as a new attacker, before the start of their normal turn. The +1 rule applies.

Win: A player wins by moving one of their counters on to the
opposing player’s home space.

boardgame.name: Hollow Mage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The frail, almost skeletal frame of a Hollow Mage belies the miracle of life that lies beneath the skin. Relying as they do on primal energies to nourish them, Hollow Mages reinforce the fact that the vastness of space-time is filled with beings of infinite variety, not just of appearance, but of nature.

These amazing and powerful beings are the definition of uniqueness. Even Hollow Mages that choose simple lives as farmers or merchants are likely to know at least a couple of Feats, even if not learned Epics. Those that devote themselves to the study of manipulating Aether are well known as some of the most powerful Epics on post-Fall Earth. They have an innate talent for space-time Feats in particular.

The second in a series of mini-expansions for the Breachworld RPG, the Hollow Mage is a unique and new character race, fully integrated into the fabric of the world.

Included in this supplement:

Hollow Mage character creation stats
Detailed background and origins
Discussion of disposition and culture
Detailed description, with new illustrations
Two new Perks and one Complication for use within the RPG
Five quick-stat Hollow Mage characters

boardgame.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation The Final Frontier
boardgame.description:
Star Trek The Next Generation The Final Frontier Action Game.

The Ferengi are up to their capitalist ways again. They have overrun the engineering room and are going after the energy matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. They are trying to steal the dilithium crystals to sell on the open market. These crystals are the energy system on the U.S.S. Enterprise. They would secure at least 5000 bars of gold pressed latinum for the Ferengi, and would turn the Starship Enterprise incapable of warp travel. Your mission is to defend the engineering room against the Ferengi and not let them get away with any of the crystals. Your mission is clear...Engage!

PLAY SUMMARY:

Get your scoops ready to catch the Ferengi as they leave the five Jefferies tube openings, as the phasers are pulled from the matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. Catch a Ferengi and get a piece of your Starship Enterprise. Catch the dilithium crystal by mistake and you loos a piece of your U.S.S. Enterprise. Be first to complete your scoring disk and you win.

boardgame.name: Smack it!
boardgame.description: A combination of War and Slapjack. Players place cards on the table, then duke it our War-style when a challenge card comes up, or try to slap the pile when a Smack It card comes up. Whoever has the highest card for a challenge, or is the first to slap the pile on a Smack It, gets the pile. Players who run out of cards are out of the game. As a twist, eliminated players may slap card piles to remove cards from play completely.

boardgame.name: Booty
boardgame.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Treasures of all types — yet the hard part is not capturing the ship's bounty, but dividing it fairly among the pirates! Players take turns splitting each round's booty into shares for the other players. Different types of treasures have different values, and of course there's the hidden items to keep people guessing. Will you be the quartermaster to give everyone their fair share – but giving yourself the best share?

Each round in Booty, cards representing treasures are revealed. Some are worth points immediately, some items cancel others, some give you a chance (but not a guarantee) for a big payday. The quartermaster, a job that travels from player to player, divides the treasures into shares and also includes the order of picking treasures in the next round. Balancing what you need, what others might want, and trying to get a little extra into your treasure pile is the key to success!

The building cards provide many special benefits that allow for a broad range of strategies every time you play.

boardgame.name: King Chocolate
boardgame.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You know there is money in chocolate, but it doesn't just grow on trees. You need to control the links in the production chain to get your cut of the cash, to make sure the cocao flows through your businesses instead of your competitors'.

Sometimes you need to help your customers and suppliers to help yourself. If you are wily, you can figure out a way for your competitors to do the work for you. Create monopolies, cut off the supply chain, disrupt other players' finely honed plans — do whatever it takes to become King Chocolate.

The fruit of the cacao tree goes through six steps to become chocolate. You can control only a few of these steps, so you must work with your fellow chocolate makers to keep the chocolate flowing through the production chain. It sounds cooperative and friendly — but did we mention that the chocolate maker with the most money wins? Things always get complicated when money is involved.

To ensure your portion of the production process is used the most so that it earns you cash, occasionally you'll help your customers and suppliers. At the same time, you will attempt to crush your competitors, force others to help you, and manipulate the supply chain.

You'll do whatever it takes to become the king of chocolate.

boardgame.name: Gomora: Down Town
boardgame.description:
Base set contains 54 unique Cards, Token Punchboard, the game's Board and Rulebook. The Extended version contains 84 unique cards, as opposed to 54 cards in the regular set.

Gomora : Downtown is a Neo-noir card game for 2-4 players. It can be played 1vs1, 2vs2 (co-op mode) or Free for all. The game is for ages 15+ and it lasts 15-45 minutes.

You are a detective in the city of Gomora. You will take a path between good and evil in a corrupt city full of eccentric and controversial characters. Nothing can be taken for granted. Your goal is to try and solve perplexing crimes that implicate multiple powerful interests. Gomora's criminal underbelly is after you....so hurry up detective.

This game consists of 84 cards each with a unique photo-realistic artwork. There are 4 tokens representing the 8 Detectives and a game board with 4 locations to move around in order to find clues and complete your case.

When your turn starts you draw a card or you store cards under your case. Then you have to move to a different location and play it's ability if you wish to. The third step allows you to play your cards. Alternatively you can rest during the third step so that you recover one life point. After you are done playing cards, make sure to keep only 4 cards in your hand and you turn is over.

“You already paid for your passage? Well that was just for the subway ticket. Nobody gets through our station at night unharmed without paying our protection fee. ”

Subway Station is a subterranean map of a modern subway terminal.

Subway Station is intended for use in modern or near future science fiction settings. Subway Station uses the same subway lines from our Trains: Modern product allowing Game Masters to fit the subway cars from that product on this map seamlessly. For more futuristic science fiction settings, use our Metro Station map product instead.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Late Night Shakedown: The group either arrives via subway train or is waiting for a subway train to arrive at the subway station in the central area when they are approached by subway gangers that demand protection money from them. These subway gangers prefer to sit in the chairs in the dim subway walkways while sizing up and identifying people they think they can accost successfully. The group has to decide how to approach the situation through paying the fee to avoid a fight or by intimidating or fighting the extortionists.

boardgame.name: Blue Water Fleet
boardgame.description:
Two fleets clash in a fast paced and exciting game of naval and air combat for two players - or up to four players if two sets of the game are used, Each player tries to find his opponent's ships, hidden within sea cards - and sink them before his opponent do the same.

The game is played with two sets of 'sea' cards arrayed in 5 stacks of 7 cards each - a total of 35 sea cards for each player/fleet, in those cards the players must hide 6 ships: Battleship, Cruiser, Aircraft carrier, two destroyers, submarine and two Mines cards, the ships and mines can be placed in any order and possition within those 5 stacks.

During the game the players use a selection of three types of action cards, attack cards (red) Recon cards (blue) and Fleet cards (green), at each round players start with six cards on their hand, their composition (how many cards from each type they will have) is given by the 'formation' their fleet is following, for example: the recon formation will give more recon cards to a player than attack and fleet cards while a more aggresive formation (Full attack) will give to the player more attack cards than recon and fleet.

While the players only have six action cards on their hands at the start of each round discarding any that they use during the round and drawing new ones to replenish their hand (according to the formation they are in) they also have the 'Hangar deck' space, where they may land aircraft cards (some cards within the action decks are 'Aircraft cards') the hangar deck can have up to 6 aircraft cards and those cards can be used to attack and or to defend the fleet from attacking aircraft, a land/resupply system of not-ready / ready aircraft in the game simulates the whole process of landing aircraft supplying them and taking them off to accomplish missions.

Game Contents:
70 sea cards.
63 attack cards.
63 recon cards.
63 fleet cards.
lots of damage counters.
2 formation dials
2 formation pointers
2 hangar space decks.
Rulebook
game was ranked 6th in the Epitrapezio contest (Greece 2015)

boardgame.name: Renaissance Wars
boardgame.description:
It was a time of wealth and intrigue. A turbulent time, when wars were fought over religion and territory. A time when artists, architects and writers explored the nature and potential of man and a time when horizons were broadened so far, that a whole new world was discovered!

In Renaissance Wars you play the game as a Renaissance Luminary... someone whose influence and fame has transcended his own time! Using only your unique Luminary powers, the cards in your hand and cunning strategy, you will battle up to 3 opponents to accumulate the wealth and power necessary to dominate each era of the game.

But be careful... because when you least expect it, something may occur that completely upsets the balance of power and may destroy even the most carefully laid plans!

The base game contains 6 playable Luminaries - William Shakespeare, Martin Luther, Fillipo Brunelleschi, St. Ignatius of Loyola, Christopher Columbus and Francis Bacon - all of which come with their own unique Luminary Mats, cards and portaits. Up to 6 more Luminaries will be available in Special Editions.

Unique Event and Intrusion cards are randomly seeded into the game during set-up, so you never know exactly what you may encounter!

Featuring beautiful art and history, Renaissance Wars explores the people and events that made the Renaissance one of most interesting, creative and important historical eras.

boardgame.name: Sub Runners
boardgame.description:
Sub Runners is a historical-fiction Pacific submarine adventure.

STORY

In 1942, As VJ day looms near, Maximillion Erhardt directs a secret submarine full of Chinese gold to secret locations to secure retirement gold for Nazi SS. Gary Shaft, a captain in the American Navy, is on the hunt for the submarine and, most importantly, the gold. Meanwhile, Hajime Yamamoto stockpiles ammunitions and weapons to mine the incoming American Fleet.

A generation later...

America Shaft looks on as her son Kirk dives deeper than he has ever swam before checking on a local tip about the Nazi Gold. The modern spy and government infiltrator, Olli Valentiner, manipulates the local governments, listing the Shafts as enemies of state. In other news, a string of murders has occurred across Asia as the twins, Hero and Kira Yamamoto leave their mark on the traitors who lost their family’s wealth.
GOALS

Sub Runners is a card-driven deduction game for three players. Players take on the roles of three families: The Erdharts, The Shafts, or The Yamamotos. Players gather resources across the world trying to complete their initial goals. The Erhardts: to make three gold deposits, The Yamamotos: to sink the search Corvette, and The Shafts: to sink the submarine. Once the submarine has been mined, Heinrich dies, or the submarine completes three drops, it crashes somewhere in the vast ocean.

The final goals now come to bear. The Shafts must find the crash in the ocean and then recover the gold. The Yamamotos may recover the gold or kill all the other players. The Erhardts may kill the other players or defend the crash site until one of the play decks has been exhausted to win.

boardgame.name: Black Hand
boardgame.description:
Black Hand is a bluffing and deduction microgame for 3 to 6 players. In it, players take on the role of members of the Black Hand, the secret society responsible for the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand and the beginning of World War I. The aim is to correctly guess the correct combination of assassination weapons (pistols, knives, bombs, and poison) required to kill the Archduke. There’s a hitch in the plans, however—there are traitors hidden within the Black Hand, who work for the Crown and are looking to uncover the assassination plot! Players are secretly divided into those loyal to the cause and traitors who seek to thwart the plot to assassinate the Archduke. Players have to determine who they can trust and who is hiding an ulterior motive!

This game was designed to be entered into the 2015 BGG & Geekway to the West Microgame Competition. It is played with 46 mini-cards (each mini-card is half the size of a poker-size playing card).

boardgame.name: Eagle Eyes
Gli Occhi dell'Aquila
Los Ojos del guila
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sharpen your blade. It’s time to hit the mean and dusty streets of Rome.

Experience Roman noir firsthand in Eagle Eyes, the latest Fate World of Adventure from Pete Woodworth. Battle cynicism, corruption and murder in the shadow of the Coliseum. Play Eagles, the Senate's private investigators, and use every means at your disposal to get at the truth behind everything from "ordinary" murders and robberies to high treason, noble intrigue, military coup attempts, and perhaps even the strange and terrible excesses of the Emperors.

Life is cheap and the dust of Rome soaks up a lot of blood, but the rewards for those that survive are beyond the dreams of lesser men.

Eagle Eyes requires Fate Accelerated or Fate Core to play. This 43-page supplement contains:

An in-depth look at the setting of ancient Rome in Fate
A twist on Fate Accelerated approaches that allows characters to invoke Roman deities
GM advice on dealing with characters of different social classes and group dynamics
System constructs for conspiracies and mysteries in Fate
Adventure seeds to get you started gaming


Eagle Eyes. Some things cannot be left unseen…

boardgame.name: Stock Ticker
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Stock Ticker is a Java reiteration of the classic board game of the same name.

The player begins with $5000 cash and can buy and sell units of stocks in the gold, silver, bond, industry, oil, and grain sectors.

Two rounds of die rolling occur between the buying and selling phase in which stocks move up or down or pay out dividends if doing well.

A player can compete with others to attain the most cash at the end of the game or play solo and work to beat a personal record.

boardgame.name: Legendary Showdown: Machines & Magic
boardgame.description:
Legendary Showdown: Machines and Magic combines the worlds of Girl Genius & Gunnerkrigg Court to create comically epic battles!

The worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court are about to collide in a legendary showdown! Legendary Showdown: Machines & Magic is a game of comically epic battles where each player uses strategy, sabotage, and one-upmanship to develop a secret battle plan. This lighthearted and easy-to-learn tabletop game is designed to be enjoyed by experienced gamers and newcomers alike. Haven’t read the comics before? No problem! No background reading is required to help your characters win battles and be the last one left standing! Let the mass chaos, devious strategies, and humorous battles begin!

Who is this Girl Genius?
Girl Genius is a three-time winner of the highest honor awarded for works of science fiction and fantasy: the prestigious Hugo Award. The webcomic follows Agatha Clay, a seemingly mild-mannered mechanic who discovers she has inherited the abilities of a spark (a feared mad scientist with the natural ability to understand complex sciences and wield them for their own chaotic purposes). Even more shocking, Agatha discovers that she is the descendent of a long lost line of sparks whose unparalleled skills and insanity made them legends in their own time. Cleverly written and beautifully illustrated by Kaja and Phil Foglio, Girl Genius is full of adventure, romance, and plenty of MAD SCIENCE!

What is this “Gunnerkrigg Court” of which you speak?
This highly praised comic is the work of the celebrated author and artist, Tom Siddell. The story follows Antimony Carver as she attends an isolated boarding school called Gunnerkrigg Court. Antimony soon learns that the Court is no ordinary school - the teachers are hiding ancient conspiracies, it is bordered by a forest full of dangerous monsters, and the school is inhabited by strange creatures and students with special abilities. In the course of her adventures, Antimony befriends an ancient trickster god, discovers her own supernatural powers, and begins investigating the dark secrets of the court.

Why do we love these comics so darn much?
If you aren’t already faithful readers, allow me to let you in on a little secret: these comics rock. The stories are masterfully crafted, the art is top notch, and the characters are instantly endearing. It's no wonder that these comics have won so many rewards and attracted such loyal fans. We also appreciate that both comics feature characters who make great role models. For example, Antimony Carver and Agatha Clay are some of the strongest and most intelligent women you could hope to meet and their friends will stop at nothing to stand by their sides.

How to play the game that will... change your life:
Each player is dealt a total of five characters from the worlds of Girl Genius and Gunnerkrigg Court. These characters line up in anticipation for their chance to battle. During the round, you try to equip characters in your line with powerful weapons and bonuses while equipping characters in other players’ lines with faulty or otherwise terrible equipment. You can also give yourself secret advantages or sabotage your opponents. When the round ends, the characters at the front of each line will engage in a (legendary) showdown. But the madness doesn’t stop there! You can rearrange your line and the lines of your opponents to change who will be competing in the final battle. The round suddenly ends when all players but one (the poor chap) are ready to fight. At that point, each player reveals his or her battle strategy and the winner is decided.

The Land of the Blind
Scenario

Villain: None
Henchemen: Shipwrecks

During This Scenario:
Shuffle 6 Gholdako henchmen into the blessings deck. After you advance the blessings deck, if the top card of the blessings discard pile is a Gholdako, put it on top of a random open location deck. boardgame.name: Switching to Guns (Issue XLIX - Apr 2009)
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

The next two issues are a two-part conclusion to the Ashford Valley campaign. I started this campaign by writing 30 adventures in groups of 5. The sets of adventures should have advanced the PCs to higher levels. If played in order, the PCs should have reached 2nd level by the end of the High Bridge Road adventures, 3rd level for the Deep Forest Road, 4th for Ashford, 5th for Clifton, 6th for Tradetown and 7th for Sooton. That will make the PCs pretty powerful. However, I designed each adventure to be able to be played by 1st through 3rd level PCs, so it is necessary (and fairly obvious) that each adventure be increased in difficulty by the GM. All this was done to come to this point - the necromancer's end game.

This issue will outline the plans and goals of the necromancer, while next issue I'll talk about the necromancer himself and some of his minions that the PCs haven't met yet.

boardgame.name: Everlasting Summer
boardgame.description:
Meeting Semyon, the game's main character, you would've never paid attention to him. Just an ordinary young man with thousands, even hundreds of thousands of those like him in every ordinary city. But one day something completely unusual happens to him: he falls asleep in a bus in winter and wakes up... in the middle of a hot summer. In front of him is "Sovionok" – a pioneer camp, behind him is his former life. To understand what happened to him, Semyon will have to get to know the local inhabitants (and maybe even find love), find his way in the complex labyrinth of human relationships and his own problems and solve the camp's mysteries. And answer the main question - how to come back? Should he come back?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Siege
boardgame.description: The board for The Siege features a 3D castle. The castle is easy to assemble and fits snugly back into the box without the need to dismantle it. The game is asymmetric – one player (or a team of up to three) attacks the castle, and the other player (or team) is defending it. Knight models come in six colours. All knights are armed with either swords or maces. The blue ones always attack the castle, and are the only team to have two catapults. The red ones always defend. Four of the red knights have bows and arrows instead of melee weapons. The remaining four teams are black, orange, yellow and green. The number of knights in different teams is not always the same. There are always more defenders than attackers. Combat is conducted in duels. Mace wielding combatants have the upper hand, but the outcome is decided by rolling the dice. Each player is trying to overpower their opponents by outnumbering them in isolated combats. Apart from the knights, the box also includes a king, a queen, a princess, a wizard, a dragon and a squire. These models are used in special scenarios.

boardgame.name: Anything To Declare?: The International Game of Smuggling and Detection
boardgame.description:
You are the owner of a shipping line required to unload containers in a port, and move around the board collecting cargoes for delivery to a warehouse. As well as this, you must control movements of your lorry and also use your own customs security piece to follow and challenge containers carried by other players.

The bluff element in the game centres around decisions on whether to pay premiums to insure cargoes moving through the docks, and once at the lorry park you must decide whether to declare goods for payment or not.

Strategy elements include decisions on which piece you will move on each turn, or whether you use you throw to hire a forklift or crane. The detection element involves guessing whether all your opponents are as innocent as they pretend or if they are not declaring their full cargo.

boardgame.name: Hinaga Monastery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A Japanese - style temple monastery complex, set in hilly terrain. A rocky stream makes it's way through a valley before passing under a wooden bridge, winding past cherry blossom trees. The temple is reached via a set of steep stone steps that pass devotional statues on the way to the main gate. The monastery complex is surrounded by a low wall, and contains several buildings linked by wooden-columned corridors.

Uses: Visit the warrior-priests and monks who live in the temple, work as a Ninja to infiltrate the complex and assassinate the Samurai general who is visiting, seek understanding from the wise priests who dwell in the hillside monastery.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)


Note: Whilst the download looks large, it consists of several separate files - just download the versions you need.

A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

boardgame.name: Countdown to Disaster
boardgame.description:
You’re a military demolitions expert working in hostile territory that’s been called in to defuse a massive car bomb found outside a luxury resort hotel. You’ve evacuated the parking lot and setup your equipment; you begin to examine the bomb when suddenly the bomb timer starts to countdown from 16 minutes and your heart rate just went into overdrive. Upon further inspection you notice the bomb is controlled by an encrypted code sequencer and you need to figure out how to connect your Code Analyzer to the bomb’s timer. Your new high-tech Code Analyzer is used to bypass the bomb’s timer and prevent the bomb from exploding. To do this you must figure out the wiring sequence from the mass of wires in front of you and rewiring the device to include your code analyzer, which will override the timer and allow you to defuse the bomb safely! You have less than 16 minutes to figure out the wiring sequence and connect your Code Analyzer. If you can figure out this circuit and connect each of the four individual wires from the bomb timer to your code analyzer, you will safely stop the timer and eventually defuse the bomb; saving the resort from certain disaster! Countdown to disaster begins…

Countdown to Disaster is a combination tile placement, card management game and race against the clock style game. Your Code Analyzer has [4] color coded wires “Red, Green, Blue and Yellow” which must be connected to the timer of the bomb so as to be able to bypass the timer and prevent the bomb from exploding! These connections will be made through the [16] wire routing tiles on the game board. The bomb itself is amass of wires, which is represented by the 4x4 grid of wire tiles on the game board that are routed in different directions to try and prevent you from defusing the robot. Your goal is to figure out the four individual wire routes to connect your code analyzer to the robot's timer. You must figure out a complete connection route for each wire from the code analyzer to the bomb's timer before the timer runs out and the bomb explodes!
You have special wiring tools that allow you to manipulate the wires and create or change the route of each existing wire or wires. With your tools in hand you can swap wires vertically and horizontally 1, 2, or 3 spaces. You can also rotate the direction of a specific wire or wire group up to 360 degrees. The last tool allows you to actually cut out “replace” a wire or wire group with a new wire or wire group from the bottom four tiles! When you replace a wire or wire group you can rotate the tile to the position of your choice.

boardgame.name: The Cookie
boardgame.description:
The Cookie is a quick card game that will make you use your detective skills or just take risks. You will be secretly playing as one of the six extraordinary characters, trying to figure out who your target is and staying unexposed at the same time (because one of the players is after you! Pam-pam-paaaaaaam).

Each player will have a target character who they'll need to attack and another character, who'll try to attack them. This is defined by the special reminder card.
As the game proceeds, each participant will be playing character cards from their hand, giving opponents hints that help them to figure out who their character is. When the player makes up his mind, he can play a special Sword card to attack his target (the player who represents the character he hunts) or a special Shield card to protect himself from someone, who, as he thinks, might attack him. At the end of the round players score victory points for attacking or defending from the right character.

boardgame.name: Viking Conquerors: An Epic Game of Viking Adventure.
boardgame.description:
BACKGROUND: Viking Conquerors is an adventure game for 1-4 Players, where players assume the roles of young Viking Huskarls (minor Chieftains) during in the Middle Ages. Each Player creates a Viking Character in search of Wealth, Adventure and Renown. To survive and thrive in the harsh and unforgiving world of Medieval Europe, the Player Vikings must take part in Raids, Blood-Feuds, Exploration, and Conquest. As your Viking gains experience and renown they can improve their attributes and Social and Military Status to eventually become Jarls (Earls) or even a King!

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Objective of each Player Viking is to Gain the most Territories and Renown Points in order to increase your Social and Military Standing. Player Vikings start out as Huskarls, a minor Chieftain with right to own a Ship and in control of one Territory.

GAME FEATURES: Viking Conquerors features many, many colorful game counters, rules for brutal man-to-man combat resolved in a fast and fun manner, and loads of Viking lore.

Taking on roles of powerful mystical characters like the Druid, the Shaman or the Wizard, players will brew potions to grow their magical power, while casting spells to stop others from getting ahead. Cauldron is a resource management game that plays with 2-5 players aged 10+ in 1 hour.

Play revolves around a central set of fields, producing potion ingredients each season (frog legs, spider webs, dragon eggs etc). Each player has potions - way to combine ingredients to score Magik (game's victory points and currency). Players take turns harvesting ingredients, brewing potions and attempting to steal ingredients from competitors. Each player also has a hand of spells - one-time effects that help the player or hinder opponents. Each character has variable powers that modifies the way basic actions are resolved.

After all ingredients have been harvested, players have a chance to invest some of their Magik to buy additional potions, spells or add fields to the game board. Balancing investment with advancement is a crucial part of the game.

The game proceeds until one of the player reaches 35 Magik - that player is the winner. The game has an element of luck and conflict present but the majority of it revolves around resource management, planning and balancing short and long term investment.

boardgame.name: Chaos Tactics
boardgame.description:
Chaos Tactics is a dexterity game where skill and strategy are needed to defeat your opponent by using your army of eight units. Players battle over a series of rounds by flicking their units until one player claims the entire board. Each army contains seven different unit types with one type, the soldier, having two units per side. The six non soldier units have special abilities that can be used throughout the game. The constant action will create chaotic battles making each round feel like an entirely new game.
The player using the blue pieces starts the game by choosing one of their pieces and flicking it. Once the piece is flicked, resolve any special abilities if applicable. The red player then takes their first turn by doing the same. Play alternates like this until the round is over; with the goal being to knock all of the opponent’s pieces off the game board entirely. If any part of a piece is still on the game board, it is still in play.

A round is won when only one color remains on the board. With each round won, the winner claims a new row allowing them to place a piece or pieces in that row in the next round. For the following rounds, players may place their pieces in any of the spaces of the rows they own, with at least one piece in the row closest to their opponent.

The game is won when one color has claimed all eight rows.

Inspired by Chapayev

CONJURE INK is a Game-Master-Only supplement to The Rogue Mage RPG by Spike Y Jones.

Leviticus 19:28 "Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you."

Tattoos are forbidden within orthodox society, and branding is a form of punishment, not adornment. None of the Most High's seraphs, nor any of the kylen of the Realms of Light, sport tattoos.

So why have the bodies of so many Dark mortals killed in recent skirmishes been decorated with tattoos? And why are there more of them on Dark mages than on Dark mules or humans?

Is it just another example of Dark mortals spitting in the face of the Most High and the orthodoxy? Or have the Dragons found another edge in the conflict with the forces of Light?

boardgame.name: Swamped
boardgame.description:
Swamped is a semi-cooperative game of adventure, peril and treasure in which players move through a swamp searching for a rare herb that can cure diseases. Each player takes a turn steering the boat to find the herb. But the swamp has many other treasures as well, so players may try to steer the boat away from its intended goal to increase their own wealth.

Swamped is a game for 2-4 adventurers that plays in about 30 minutes and expands the vibrant world of Antidote. In addition to a one-of-a-kind theme, there are five core elements that make Swamped incredibly fun and a surprisingly unique gaming experience:

1. Player-shared pieces: All players share ownership of the same tiny boat in the swamp, so the actions of any one player impact every other player directly.

2. Secret and shared objectives: Everyone knows the main objective, but each player also has a hidden goal that might lead the whole expedition into deadly peril!

3. Player controlled game-length: Players can speed-up or slow-down the game down depending on their preference. Some will try to get out of the swamp quickly, while others will delay until they've collected precisely the right combination of treasures.

4. Surprise ending: It is unlikely that anyone can know with 100% certainty who has won the game before each player's secret objective is revealed, leading to an exciting reveal at the very end!

5. Efficient use of physical components: Despite its small size (35 cards and two pieces), most cards have multiple uses and orientations leading to a surprisingly deep set of decisions each player can make. Furthermore, as players move deeper into the swamp, the swamp expands from the action card deck, opening up greater adventure, while at the same time triggering a built-in game timer.

boardgame.name: Compendium Arcanum Volume 5: 4th-Level Spells
Compendium Arkanum Volume 05: 4th-Level Spells
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compendium Arcanum Volume 5: 4th-Level Spells continues where volume 4 left off! This book includes 113+ pages of 4th-Level spells for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, now with Heightened and Diminished effects!

A multi-variable spell is a spell which, once learned, you can cast as a spell one level higher or lower than the original spell. This mechanic was first introduced in Monte Cook’s Arcana Evolved. Multi-variable spells give spellcasters great flexibility and so Tim decided to begin by adding the Heightened and Diminished qualities to Pathfinder spells.

So, in addition to the normal Pathfinder spell details, you will see one or two new bits of text, specifically, either a “Diminished Effects” line, a “Heightened Effects” line, or both. This is the first book of a set intended to include all spells from the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook, Advanced Player’s Guide, Ultimate Combat, and Ultimate Magic, now with heightened and diminished effects.

DIMINISHED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level lower than normal. You must be able to cast a spell at its regular Level before you can use the diminished effects. If you use a diminished effect, treat the spell as one Level lower than listed for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on. Spells that are 0-level (or 1st-level alchemist-, paladin-, or ranger-only spells) have no diminished effects.

HEIGHTENED EFFECTS

This section describes changes to the spell if it is cast using a slot one Level higher than normal. If you use a heightened effect, treat the spell as one Level higher than listed, for purposes of spell slot used, saving throw DCs, magic item pricing, and so on, regardless of what Level slot you use. Spells that are 9th Level (or 6th-level alchemist-only spells or 4th-level paladin- or ranger-only spells) have no heightened effects.

boardgame.name: Round We Go
boardgame.description:
Round We Go is a strategic family board game.

The goal is to race to the center of the board. First person to get both of their player pieces to the center wins the game.

The trick is that pieces are unable to turn on their own, which can cause you to go round and round on the circular board, unless you plan accordingly.

Players must strategically place arrow pieces on the board to either help them advance or force opponents to backtrack. However, it is important to remember, in a game of circles, sometimes what goes around comes around.

boardgame.name: Sikarra: Volcano Island
boardgame.description:
Sikarra, a volcano island rich in a rare resource that could launch your corporation years ahead in their research…or one of the multiple other companies that are racing to find it before you. Extracting the resources from Sikarra will not be an easy job; it is rife with dangers; cannibals, pterodactyls, and the volatile volcano itself. The slopes of the volcano are covered in a dense jungle that is very difficult for modern machinery to penetrate. The only people able to move through this difficult terrain easily are the local tribe…rumor has it they may even be able to travel on the backs of the great winged pterodactyls that circle the volcano. Befriending the tribe may be the only way for your corporation to be the first to reach the rare resources and come out on top.

“Jungle power rules Sikarra. In the jungle the tribe is king…”

The game is playable by 2-4 players.

Players vie against one another for control of the 6 territories of Sikarra attempting to harvest its rare resources while making use of favors traded by other players for much needed equipment. Players will need to stay a step ahead of the deadly volcano, cannibals and circling pterodactyls all the while trying to befriend the ruling tribe through completion of tasks in the tribes name if they want to succeed let alone stay alive.

Winning Conditions: Players must gain support of the tribe (10 support) or have enough forces to overpower the tribe (10 pieces of equipment). The way players gain the support of the tribe is by completing tasks that support the tribe from the tasks list.

Task List:


Build a tribute to the tribe on a territory you control. Cost: 2 Resources & 1 Equipment
Give back to nature. Select one free area and keep it clear of harvesting for one round.
Slash and Burn. Destroy a section of jungle in a territory you control. Gain 3 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.
Bribe local officials. Move once for free at any time this round. Cost: 2 Resources. Move down one spot on tribe support track.


Players move through the following phases each round while trying to show the tribe they are most worthy of their support to control each resource rich territory:

1. Purchase/Place Equipment
2. Cannibals Attack.
3. Politics/Tasks.
4. Lava/Ash Track.
5. Harvest.
6. Intrigue.
7. Move.

Can you lead your corporation to success? Can you harvest the power of the jungle and rule Sikarra: Volcano Island?

boardgame.name: Linkeballen
Le Tour de France
boardgame.description:
A strategic cycling parlor game for 2-4 players, 8 years and above

Will your team win the tour?
Going for the yellow or do you choose for the team? Climbing the hills or pushing it on a flat stage?
Keep in mind you’re not the only one cycling the road… A small steering error, misjudgment or a ‘cycling strategy’ can cause a sensational collision.
Let your cycling team ride as fast as possible and win the bike race!

Introduction
In this parlor game you play within the stages as a cycling team. A team consists of three riders. The basic game can be played with 2 to 4 players. The duration of a one stage game with 4 players is 1 to 1.5 hours.
. The results of your team and players standings are recorded. A Tour consists of several stages, with the fastest rider over several stages wearing the yellow jersey. You decide for how long and which stages you want to play.
The game is played with cards. By placing a card on the table you decide how fast you are moving your riders on the trail. You try taking tactical moves and benefit from wind advantage by letting your opponent do the hard work. Cast or save your good cards to démarrage when you feel that your opponent cannot. In short: “Linkeballen”.

Note:
If you have the additions as well, you can play up to 24 players.

All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.
8. Other matters
We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Such cases arise only very exceptionally; we try to ensure that everything we advertise in our web shop is in stock. Where, for whatever reason, we are unable to deliver we promptly refund in full everything you have paid.
9. Limitation of liability: external links
Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.
11. Severability clause
If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

boardgame.description:
From a peaceful training village to a hell-like demon world, you become Ninja Guy, in his bizarre and epic quest to prove himself to the Holy Cow Sensei and bring down an evil gargantuan Minotaur!

boardgame.name: The Legends of Sinbad
boardgame.description:
From the publisher
This is not a genre piece!

The Legends of Sinbad is a new sword-and-sorcery campaign set on Earth in the year 801 C.E.

Inspired by the Harryhausen Sinbad trilogy but based on real-world mythologies, histories, and legends, as well as the tales of the Arabian nights, the game is more than a Prince of Persia tale. As you can see from the map below (which is not yet complete--more cities will be added as development continues), a wide variety of cultures are represented. In this one era, you can find every RPG setting imaginable. You have the Vikings in the Norselands; feudal Europe with the Anglo-Saxon Kingdoms and the Carolingian Empire; wild, druidic barbarians in the Celtic Kingdoms; a classical feel with the Eastern Roman Empire; savage nomadic hordes with the Kazar Khaganate; and Arabic with the Abassid Caliphate.

And each culture brings with it its own monsters from mythology--kraken, gray dwarves, and frost giants in the Norselands; dragons and centaurs in the Carolingian Empire; trolls and ogres in the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms; brownies and banshees in the Celtic kingdoms; gorgons and hydras in the Eastern Roman Empire; and djinn in the Kingdom of the Moors; just to name a few!Of course, there is a lot more to this setting than just the above. This is just a quick note to point out that this setting is not just another Arabic genre piece, but a vibrant, versatile, and unique sword-and-sorcery campaign setting!

The campaign book will be made available in Savage Worlds, and you won't need to buy the Savage Worlds book to play! This will be a complete set!

boardgame.name: Galloway
boardgame.description:
This is a card deck & game system with multiple suits, inspired by little ponies, and designed with young players in mind.

Unlike a standard deck of cards, this deck features six "mane" suits: Generosity, Honesty, Kindness, Laughter, Loyalty, and Magic.

The deck also features three other suits: Earth Pony, Pegasus, and Unicorn. The mane suits of Honesty and Laughter are adorned with the Earth Pony suit. Kindness and Loyalty are adorned with the Pegasus suit. Generosity and Magic feature the Unicorn suit.

Furthermore, another pair of suits split the deck in half: the Moon and Sun. Honesty, Laughter, and Loyalty lie under the Moon. Generosity, Kindness, and Magic under the Sun.

The deck is available as a print-and-play game.

boardgame.name: Crack the Code
boardgame.description:
Crack the Code with three levels of challenge is a brain testing game of logic and mental concentration. The object of the game is to crack the secret code of your opponent by means of simple logic and deduction. Players challenge each other in turn by setting out a row of three, four or five coloured code counters according to the level of skill and difficulty to be played. The game can be made even tougher by allowing the code maker to use any number of the same coloured counters, and or leave spaces, to make up the code.

The code maker sets up the sliding screen so that it is placed directly in front of them just allowing space to place and hide their secret code in the spaces provided. The code breaker must try to duplicate the exact colours and positions of the secret code. Each attempt is marked with a tick for an exact colour and position match or a cross for the correct colour but incorrect position.

Players swap roles and the winner is the one who breaks the code in the least number of attempts.

boardgame.name: Smuggler's Guide to the Rim
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Does your Crew have what it takes to fly the Good Shepherd’s Run?

SMUGGLER’S GUIDE TO THE RIM is a supplement for the FIREFLY RPG that is designed for both players and GMs. The third supplement in the line, the SMUGGLER’S GUIDE TO THE RIM introduces Reputation rules for Crewmembers, 12 new archetypes, the Good Shepherd’s Run, more Chinese translations, more rules, new in game aids, a pair of Episodes, and more!

We think you’ll appreciate the following:

Reputation Rules: Find out how to earn your Reputation, how to lose it, and how to make it count. While Reputation rules are player-facing, Gamemaster characters will employ Dispositions to guide interactions with the Crew. In addition to the new Reputation rules, you’ll also dive into plenty of examples, read about the four Factions in the ’Verse, and get an overview of Dispositions, too!
New Crewmember Archetypes and Boats: You’ll read about the suggested Reputation die ratings for the Serenity Crew and discover twelve, brand new archetypes along with new ships. They are: Alliance Contractor, Alliance Dogfighter, Alliance General, Folk Hero, Freedom Fighter, Roving Medic, Corporate Broker, Corporate Lackey, Corporate Researcher, Friendly Face, Lone Hood, and the Shady Entrepreneur.
Good Shepherd’s Run: Each location in the Blue Sun and Kalidasa Systems is presented like a brand new Episode for you to dive in and explore with new story ideas, ship rules, adventure ideas, new Antagonists, new Chinese phrases, and a whole lot more! In the Good Shepherd’s Run, you’ll fly to places like Deadwood, Ghost, Kuan Lo, and strange locations like The Nest!
All in the Family: Written by Margaret Weis. Nothing’s more important than family, ’cept maybe a big ole strongbox of gold coins. Bao-Huang Qin, the leader of the Dragon Tong, has tasked your Crew with recovering his loot, thought lost after it’d been confiscated by the Alliance. Qin ain’t askin’, though—he’s holding Jayne’s momma as collateral and his daughter, Fang-Hua Qin, is accompanying the Crew on this job. Easy, right? Problem is it’s on a wreck floating in Reaver space, and four mercs sent by Qin’s unlikely rival Agnes Pierce will be racin’ your Crew to the prize—and they don’t give a damn about Jayne’s momma.
Circling the Wagons: Written by Greg Stolze. Folk in the Core think they can put a leash on damn near everyone else in the ’Verse, and one of their leashes is named Special Independent Investigator Garth Mandrake. But a leash matters less to them what love power than who’s holdin’ it. Mandrake’s found himself caught between two political cliques within the Alliance. Their tiff strands him on an uncharted rock facetiously known as Barry's Kingdom, with each side hiring a ship—the Crew and their greatest rivals—to pick him up and get him under their control. The Crews got to deal with double-dealing, rampaging wrecks and the namesake of the planetoid to get the SII in hand while he’s still breathing. And that’s before the Reavers show up.
Expanded Appendix: We’ve included a brand new FAQ, Chinese translations, more Distinctions, maps for the Kalidasa and Blue Sun Systems, and a set of brand new tools for players and GMs—an Advancement Sheet that includes Reputation die ratings and a GMC Sheet to take the guesswork out of building GMCs, too!
